text:
To be honest, it looked promising, the music was good, but the twiter thing and the atrocious writing killed the game for me.
Seems like this game was made by a reddit hipster, for reddit hipsters.

I even have this game on a trash section in steam, good thing i got it with humble bundle, i like the rest of the games.
author: Raul

text: the game was a great concept, the music was what made it amazing though
author: Enrique DelSuave

text:
The game felt pretentious at first but overall it seemed very much not to take itself too seriously. And I respect that.

I thought it was actually pretty moving at the end. And the music is great.

text: I love this game. I am such a huge point'n'click nerd. This game reminds me of Simon the Sorcerer a lot, mixed with Zelda. It's really fantastic both visually and in audio.

text: For some reason my computer can't render this game, but it does look interesting. Control scheme is bizarre too...

text: Loved this game, loved this song. You pick out great OSTs.
author: Shahab Rostami

text: Not gonna lie, I hated this game. I finished it, but it was incredibly pretentious. And I'M pretentious about games to begin with.  But good god does the soundtrack kick ass! This song has gotten many spins, as well as "And We Got Older"
author: Akerfeldtfan

text: One of my favorite VG OST's! Jim Guthrie surprised me with this, and the game play was unique and interesting in it's own right. I liked this song so much, it has a place in my iTunes. I think it was the sine melody that caught my ear, and when this song occurs in the game itself. May I suggest "Unknowable Geometry"?
author: Obby

text: Man I love this game and this soundtrack. Jim Guthrie handled it, I do recommend checking his music out.
